title.narrative: Management of chemicals with focus on Agricultural pesticides Inception phase
Stöd till kemikaliehantering särsk bekämpningsmedel i jordbruket-Inledningsfas

description.narrative: Kemikalieinspektionen (KemI) har ansökt om 578,000 SEK för att finansiera inledningsfasen av projektet “Kemikaliehantering med fokus på bekämpningsmedel inom jordbruket” i Zambia under en 6-månaders period, december 2018 till maj 2019. Sammantaget syftar projektet till att minska hälsoriskerna för människor och djur samt miljörisker orsakade av kemikalieanvändning, genom att stödja genomförandet av en ny förordning inom kemikaliehantering i Zambia. Specifikt syftar inledningsfasen till att utveckla ett fullständigt projektförslag, innehållande resultatramverk, en komplett budget för projektet i sin helhet, och specifikation av projektaktiviteter. Vidare inbegriper inledningsfasen aktiviteter som syftar till att integrera perspektiv och aspekter gällande jämställdhet, fattigdom, anti-korruption och mänskliga rättigheter i projektplanen och resultatramverket. Kemikalieinspektionen kommer att genomföra projektet gemensamt med den lokala miljömyndigheten Zambia Environmental Management Agency (ZEMA).

Swedish Chemicals Agency (KemI) has applied to Sida for funding of SEK 578,000 to carry out the inception phase of the Management of chemicals with focus on Agricultural pesticides project in Zambia, during the period December 2018 to May 2019 (six months). Overall, the project aims at reducing risks to human and animal health and the environment from the use of chemicals by supporting the implementation of new and subsidiary chemicals legislation in Zambia. Specifically, the inception phase aims at developing a full proposal for the project including a results framework, a detailed budget for the entire project, and project activities. Moreover, the inception phase will include activities aimed at integrating the perspectives of gender equality, poor people, anti-corruption and human rights into the project plan and results framework. KemI will implement the intervention together with the local organization, the Zambia Environmental Management Agency (ZEMA).

description.narrative: The overall objective of the inception phase was to develop a project proposal for a bilateral cooperation between KemI and ZEMA on chemicals management in Zambia. The need for the envisioned collaboration arose from the increase in the use of chemicals in various sectors, uncoordinated and overlapping roles in chemicals management among stakeholders, lack of central data base for chemicals, limited technical capacity to analyse effects of chemicals on human health and environment and poor infrastructure for chemicals analysis. The cooperation therefore focuses on the legal framework, capacity building for inspection and enforcement, development of technical guidelines, development of chemicals data base and awareness and education on safe use of chemicals in Zambia. The main activities during the inception phase included hosting a logical framework approach (LFA) workshop with stakeholders and developing a project proposal based on outcomes of the discussions from the LFA workshop. A stakeholder’s logical framework workshop was held in Lusaka with the objective of identifying needs, facilitating selection and prioritizes of interventions for effective management of chemicals in Zambia. The workshop attracted participants from various research and Government institutions such as Food and Drugs Laboratory, University of Zambia ( Department of Chemistry, School of Public Health and School of Agriculture), Ministry of Water Development, Sanitation and Environmental Protection, Central Statistical Office, Ministry of Labour and Social Security, National Institute of Scientific and Industrial Research, Ministry of Health, Zambia Bureau of Standards, Zambia Agriculture Research Institute, Ministry of Commerce and Industry, Evelyn Hone College, Ministry of local government and Zambia Revenue Authority. During the workshop, the following were agreed upon as focus areas for effective management of chemicals in Zambia: warning system towards banning of chemicals, coordination of existing structures on chemicals management, mechanisms for monitoring both the efficacy and residue analysis report to avoid public health issues, legal provisions (MRL’s in food and drugs), in-country disposal Systems, awareness and capacity building in chemicals management. Using inputs from the workshop, KemI developed a full project proposal that has been submitted to the embassy.
